program_title: Priority Housing Access for Displaced Households
program_overview: If you live in USDA Rural Development-financed multifamily housing or apartments and are displaced from your home because of a natural disaster, you can receive priority placement in other USDA RD-financed multifamily properties.
fema_number_recommendation: While a FEMA number is not required to request a LOPE, we strongly recommend you get one.
fema_registration_requirement: If you have been displaced by a federally declared disaster such as a hurricane, flood, tornado, forest fire, or earthquake please register with the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA).
fema_number_purpose: You will be given a FEMA number to use when applying for different types of federal assistance, including housing assistance outside of the USDA.
letters_of_priority_entitlement_descript: If you are living in USDA RD-financed multifamily housing and have been displaced by a natural disaster, you can apply for a Letter of Priority Entitlement – or “LOPE” – allowing you to receive priority placement in vacant units or move to the top of waitlists in USDA RD or U.S. Housing and Urban Development (HUD)- financed multifamily housing.
lope_usage_scope: A LOPE can be used at USDA RD or HUD-financed properties anywhere in the U.S. or its territories.
lope_hud_fema_number_requirement: If you apply for priority placement at a HUD-financed property you will also need a FEMA number.
how_to_get_lope_method_2: Contact your property management company. In some cases they may have a LOPE letter ready for you already.
lope_guideline_1_proof_of_residency: You must be able to prove you lived in an eligible USDA RD-financed multifamily housing property at the time of the disaster.
lope_guideline_2_rental_subsidy: If you receive a rental subsidy at your current USDA RD-financed multifamily rental, your subsidy can follow you to your new rental.
lope_extension_option: USDA RD can extend the LOPE if you request an extension.
important_note_information_changes: Because information changes, always consult official program instructions or contact your local Rural Development office for help.
equal_opportunity_statement: USDA is an equal opportunity provider, employer, and lender.
